Ryan Harrison.Action: Shows worry and panic about being blamed for a crime he did not commit; tries to avoid attention and blend into crowds to stay safe.
Helps a percussionist tighten a timpani skin at Symphony Hall.
Turns off the lights and locks the door when he panics after a threat, but accidentally drops a knife during the process.
Walks many miles continuously while contemplating his situation, showing persistence and endurance.
Acts casual and tries to blend into a crowd and avoid police attention, but inadvertently draws attention due to an awkward positioning behind a fruit stand.
Successfully finds ways to blend into a large crowd during the Million Man March and searches for work to start a new life despite being on the run.
Attempts to find work by following 'Help Wanted' signs and takes a job assisting a percussionist at a symphony hall, demonstrating resourcefulness.
Falls accidentally hitting percussionist in face but continues helping and working diligently on instruments.
Sharpening conductor's baton in pencil sharpener (quirky but harmless).
Clumsily carries harp into doorway, not noticing it getting jammed, then jumps back but continues on.
Accidentally clips David Helfgott with piano top but promptly drops it back, leaving Helfgott trapped without helping immediately.
Reverently picks up a violin from trash, showing deep respect and care for the instrument.
Offers resin back to the baseball player after using it for his bow, demonstrating sharing and consideration.
Plays violin beautifully, eliciting praise from Cass.
Accepts Cass's invitation to get coffee and engages in friendly conversation.
Applies suntan lotion on Cass's back, inadvertently causing her to slip but does so in a caring, lighthearted way.
Responds to Cass's compliments modestly with a self-deprecating comment ('you can't make a sow from a pig’s ear').
Shares intimate and affectionate moments with Cass, including lifting her, kissing madly, and playful physicality in the elevator.
Flails arms, bangs head in the elevator during intimate moment, showing vulnerability and uninhibited expression.
Plays fantastic violin music, impressing Cass.
Doubts his own ability by saying 'you can't make a sow from a pig’s ear' when encouraged to audition.
Applies suntan lotion but squirts out more than intended, causing Cass to slip and fall.
Engages socially with Cass confidently, tipping his hat and flirting.
Romantic yet clumsy interaction in elevator leads to Cass hitting her head when doors open.

Carries Cass gently in his arms and lays her down carefully; expresses heartfelt emotions telling Cass she means a lot to him like a sister he never had, revealing vulnerability and need for kindness.
Responds with sadness but does not display anger when Cass tells him to leave because there is someone else; thanks her sincerely for helping him with an audition.
He carefully supports and lays Cass down gently in bed, showing physical control and concern.
His toes entwine with Cass's fingers and they engage in passionate love making, suggesting comfort and confidence in intimate situations.
Ryan expresses emotional vulnerability openly, saying he hasn’t had much kindness in his life and values Cass as a sister figure.
He quietly accepts rejection without argument, saying thank you for the audition and leaving calmly.
During a potentially tense moment, Ryan does not escalate conflict after Cass asks him to leave, instead he exits peacefully.
Expresses emotional pain and asserts self-worth by rejecting being treated like an object ('I'm a whole meal').
Exits the scene near tears after feeling dehumanized.
Accidentally jabs his bow into a fellow orchestra member's eye while playing vigorously.
Responds to upset Cass by continuing to play without missing a note, showing focus but no attempt to address her feelings.

Unintentionally jabs his bow into a fellow orchestra member's eye but immediately recovers without missing a note, takes another bow from a quiver and continues playing flawlessly with total concentration.
His emotional distraction causes a minor accident during playing, indicating some lapse in control although he recovers quickly.
Plays violin with deep emotion, moved to tears during performance, eliciting sobbing from the audience.
Plays the violin brilliantly, moving the audience and orchestra to tears with perfect timing and emotional expression.
Shows surprise and a moment of distraction when noticing that the Goodhue theater's box is empty, but quickly regains composure to continue handling the event.
Approaches Harry politely to get a message
Watches a threatening scene calmly without intervening
Carries a signed photo from Lauren indicating a secretive affair
Appears concerned and attentive to Lauren's troubled message
Unintentionally causes a tray spill on a socialite but does not react negatively
Approaches the old Stage Manager to get a message, showing initiative to obtain information.
Driving while concerned about a troubling message, indicating a sense of responsibility and focus.
Remembers a signed photo from Lauren, demonstrating personal reflection and awareness.
Appears naive and clumsy at the Goodhue estate, accidentally causing a tray to fall on a socialite.
Rams mallet into the crotch of a member of the Arab Consulate, causing pain.
Plays violin with enthusiasm, seems to enjoy making music and interacting with Lauren.
Expresses heartbroken feeling and politely thanks Lauren before leaving.
Rams mallet into diplomat's crotch, causing pain unintentionally.
Plays violin at audition, finishes to nice applause.
Observes Lauren's suggestive behavior carefully and notices subtle details (drawer opening/closing).
Feels he has failed after audition despite applause, indicating possible lack of confidence.
Politely but awkwardly exits after heartbroken moment, showing limited emotional composure.
Accepts a drink offered by Hibbing and shares a light moment with Lauren.
Withdraws when Hibbing attempts to kiss Lauren, showing respect for her boundaries.
Engages in friendly, playful interaction with Lauren, including a handshake with reciprocal gentle touch.
Does not initiate or reciprocate Hibbing's unwelcome advance towards Lauren.
Calmly packs up his violin and leaves without causing a scene.
Shakes a wastebasket off his foot in a seemingly composed manner despite the earlier crashing sounds.
Misreads social cues when puckering for a kiss aimed at someone else and quickly corrects himself.
Asks a direct question about signing a contract, indicating he understands the importance of formalizing agreements.
Pulls back from a kiss because he is mentally conflicted and acknowledges the woman's marital status.
Gently rests his hand on Lauren's shoulder to comfort her, showing care and tenderness.
Engages in a passionate, sensual encounter despite awareness of the moral implications.
Removes the 'bear trap' device from the steering wheel, showing awareness of safety and preparedness.
Acknowledges the inappropriateness of pursuing a married woman, showing ethical consideration and self-restraint.
Becomes distracted and entangled in the car phone cord while driving.
Calls to someone affectionately as 'Darling' when entering the house, suggesting familiarity and care.
Lets the phone cord hang tangled on the wheel instead of fixing it, indicating a lack of attentiveness to small practical details but not necessarily warmth.
Struggles in a physical confrontation with an intruder, initially feeling good about being restrained by an unseen person he perceives as familiar, showing a desire for intimacy.
Blocks Sean's punches, ducks a strike, and tackles him despite the struggle.
Struggles mightily with a cushion thrown at him but eventually throws it off and gets to his feet.
Throws a punch causing an eye attached to a spring to fall from Sean's head, indicating good aim and impact.
Is hit on the head from behind with a fireplace shovel and subsequently a coffee table is tipped over on him, leading to him being incapacitated.
Faints and hits his head while attempting to follow advice to put his head between his knees.
Moans and is unconscious after being found in a ransacked house with a dead body nearby.
Is assisted and escorted by police and paramedics after the incident, shows no indication of proactive or skillful response.
Confused and scared while being questioned aggressively by the media; cops help him through hostile crowd.
Accused of manipulation by Lauren, who describes being charmed and led to leave her partner; suggests possible insincerity.
Appears confused and scared when surrounded by media and police.
Attempts to assert his innocence by pleading 'You have to believe me. I've been wrongfully accused.'
Complies quietly with being led into the patrol car, shows fear and resignation.
Silent and passive during harsh treatment and humiliation by police and court.
Raps his head after the door is slammed in his face, then flops inside the patrol car without resistance.
Hands the correct fare in the meter and goes to his seat on the prison bus calmly.
Tries to reason calmly with the guard despite being threatened and jabbed.
Engages in a sarcastic exchange of 'how dare you' with the guard rather than escalating aggressively.
Tries to reason calmly with the guard despite hostile behavior.
Engages in a childish 'how dare you' verbal exchange with the guard instead of de-escalating.
Wears a seatbelt on the prison bus, increasing personal safety during an accident.
Unlocks the handcuffs and unties the guards and cons who are knotted together on the bus, helping to free them from their restraints.
Momentarily distracted by a light outside while untying others, but quickly refocuses on the immediate danger to save everyone.
Undoing the seatbelt while hanging upside down on a tumbling prison bus, then falling head-first to the ground.
Takes keys from the Tough Guard and methodically unlocks multiple complicated locks on his handcuffs, including one secured by a slide bolt and chain door lock.
Successfully unties the tangled prisoners, guards, and cons who are knotted together after the bus crash.
Notices a light and hears a train whistle but initially thinks nothing of it, then remembers and quickly reacts to the approaching train.
Urgently evacuates all the victims from the crashed bus through busted-out windows, acting with increasing speed as the train approaches.
Outruns a train through quick thinking and physical endurance, then laughs in relief after escaping danger.
Jumps free from the prison bus just before the train hits it, avoiding immediate danger.
Runs and takes sharp turns to evade the pursuing train, showing quick thinking and agility.
Uses the environment (boulders) to hide from the train, demonstrating situational awareness.
Stops running when exhausted and faces the approaching train, but remains calm and attentive to surroundings.
Laughs in relief once the train veers off, indicating confidence and emotional resilience.
Kills the driver during prison bus wreck and escapes custody.
Beats the train and escapes the prison bus wreck, showing quick timing and physical capability.
Gets hit on the head by the crossing gate immediately after escaping, resulting in a quick fall.
Politely asks Roman for water when thirsty.
Steals clothes including a woman's blouse to disguise.
Gathers stolen clothes, quickly changes while running, evades a dog by jumping a fence, and recovers quickly after bumping into a tree.
Loses sight of his surroundings and bangs into a tree while changing clothes.
Approaches a gas station owner calmly to ask for water despite being tired and sweaty.
Draws big, Buddy Holly glasses, a long ZZ Top beard, and blacks out a few teeth on his own Wanted poster.
Accurately recalls and lists many specific brand names and fishing-related details, demonstrating detailed knowledge.
Pronounces 'menzrum' instead of 'mens room', showing a slight verbal slip.
Quickly and quietly exits the scene when Roman pulls a gun, avoiding confrontation.
Cautiously approaches the house and ensures no one is watching before peeking in the window, showing careful and tactical behavior.
Sneaks into a house by breaking the door glass and unlocking the door without permission.
Grabs Cass’s wrist and uses a sarcastic, somewhat confrontational tone when questioning her presence.
Finds a way inside the house by skillfully breaking the glass and unlocking the door.
Carefully hides when hearing a key in the door and confronts Cass with confidence.
Remembers confusing flashbacks and does not understand their meaning.
Extracts useful information from charred map fragments and interprets key clues like 'submarine' and 'Hylander.'
Engages Cass in a sharp, somewhat sarcastic conversation, showing wit and a guarded attitude.
Says to Cass 'I think you're innocent.'
Acknowledges he has been mistreated but asserts boundaries firmly to Cass, telling her 'I've been Mr Doormat long enough' and 'Stay away.'
Works intently with a weedwhacker to cut down a fence and other items, undeterred by personal discomfort (cutting tips of his shoes).
Runs across a busy street and endures a street sweeper ordeal unscathed, showing determination but no overt social warmth or friendliness.
Works diligently cutting down fence pickets, lamppost, mailbox, and flowers without being noticed.
Fails to notice damage to his shoes while working, showing lack of attention to detail.
Lays down on the highway to avoid an oncoming truck, demonstrating quick reflex and calmness under pressure.
Gets caught and spun around by street sweeper brushes, ending dizzy and disoriented, showing vulnerability and lack of control.
Unable to evade Fergus and his team effectively; he is caught and almost captured.
Slides down tunnel on his back like a waterslide, tears off fencing to free jam, narrowly escapes boulder by swinging on a root.
Runs through drainage tunnel in a frantic search, showing persistence and resilience.
Raises hands in panic when caught and threatened with leg shackles and ball and chain.
Slides down a tunnel like a waterslide, frees the jam by tearing off fencing, escapes a huge rolling boulder by swinging on a root, displays physical agility and quick thinking.
Leans forward at an impossible angle over a dam spillway pipe to check a situation, showing curiosity and risk-taking but ends up trapped.
Raises hands in panic when confronted by Fergus and is apprehended with leg shackles and ball and chain.
Gains a bit of courage, attempts to escape by leaping despite danger and physical obstacles.
Forgets about the low tunnel ceiling, bangs his head and becomes disoriented, falls down.
Survives violent river conditions, adapts by catching a fish in his mouth and tries to climb up the spillway.
Expresses need for someone to believe in and a friend, puts arm around Cass after she kisses him.
Looks out window vigilantly, pulls shades and secures the condo thoroughly after arriving.
Despite being wet and exhausted, Ryan stays alert and quickly responds to the sudden appearance of Cass's car and the police helicopter, showing situational awareness and quick reaction.
Ryan changes into clothes provided by Cass and accepts her help, indicating adaptability and trust in allies.
Ryan nervously searches and secures the condo by pulling shades over windows and doors, showing cautiousness and attention to security.
Ryan expresses a vulnerable need for belief and friendship openly, revealing emotional reliance rather than confidence at the moment.
Turns away from railing in frustration, admits he can't relax and feels hunted.
Resists trusting Cass initially but accepts her help, engages with her honestly.
Gently pushes a wisp of hair off Cass's forehead, showing a tender gesture.
Checks into and behind everything in the room, actively investigating.
Recognizes that the tape from Hibbing's answering machine is not proof to the cops and assesses his situation as a 'cornered badger' who must live by his wits.
Expresses frustration and reluctance to relax, showing awareness of his predicament but also stress.
Focuses on clearing himself by trying to find someone described as the 'one-armed, one-legged, one-eyed man,' showing persistence and methodical thinking.
Does not explicitly follow up or act decisively on the new clues like the burnt map or the numbers discussed.
Gently pushes a lock of hair off her forehead; kisses her on the forehead leaving a red lipstick mark.
Admits difficulty with relationships (‘me and women, we're like fire and water’).
Allows Cass to help him when exhausted, relies on her support.
Expresses attraction and acknowledges incompatibility with women; uses a memorable, confident phrase before entering the condo.
Collapses from exhaustion immediately after entering the condo, requiring physical support.
Dismisses struggling artists as untrustworthy for a million dollars.
Quietly closes door and stealthily searches Cass’s dresser for information.
Examines scrapbook thoughtfully to learn more about Cass’s life and public perception.
Panic and quick exit, throws face powder at Cass to escape.
Recognizes Mary Kelley from the article and identifies letters connecting her to Northern Ireland.
Panics when Cass enters with a gun and mistakenly throws face powder in his own face while trying to escape.
Quickly retrieves the answering machine tape amidst chaos and uses a smoke cloud to mask his retreat.
Escapes through a bathroom window by improvising with a toilet as a step stool.
Cleverly escapes by hiding in a hamper and endures unpleasant conditions without complaint to avoid capture.
Panics briefly after escape but quickly regains composure and moves forward.
Rubs perfume ads over his body, tries to disguise himself to enter hospital covertly.
Enters hospital and pretends to be Dr. Sanchez to help in emergency despite not being a real doctor.
Adjusts IV drip intending to help patients, moves quickly between patients attempting to act as a doctor.
Orders nurses and medical staff around, aggressively demands treatments without regard for medical protocol.
Dismisses concerns of medical staff and shows impatience ('Damn your 'but!''), but motivated by desire to save a human life.
Refuses to interact with woman in stirrups ('Ah, no thanks').
Physically attacks security guard, punches him in the face, draws and conceals his gun, forcibly drags him into elevator.
Says 'Don't speak. Ssssh. Put your hand in my pocket.' to Cass in a sweet, tender tone, expressing affection.
Responds sarcastically and mockingly when Cass expresses love, grabbing her shoulders and teasing her.
Expresses love and affection calling Cass 'Princess' and using a gesture of affection placing hands on his head.
Accuses Cass of calling the police and betraying his trust after she said she believed him innocent.
Uses metaphorical language and wit to try to make a point, showing some verbal skill and confidence.
Appears confused and overwhelmed, admits quitting thinking days ago, indicating a lack of clear mental focus or planning.
Engages in a somewhat disjointed and erratic conversation, struggling to keep track of facts and relationships, showing less coherence.
Says 'I'm going to trust you' despite confusion and little time, showing willingness to rely on Cass.
Engages Cass in collaborative problem-solving (asking for hairpin, working with her on distraction).
Uses suction cups skillfully to navigate duct work and attempts to enter restricted areas stealthily.
Loses his balance and falls through an opening while spreading wires in the duct.
Catches all fallen personal items skillfully without damaging or losing them.
Meticulously and carefully operates a complex computer system to help erase damaging records.
Acknowledges the answering machine message with concern and emotional reaction (heartsick, slamming fist on table) over Cass's situation.
Carelessly types the print command causing thousands of pages to print, creating a mess he cannot control.
Drives the car but not successfully; backs into a 'potty,' causing a public scene and surprising bystanders.
Feels the texture of a woman's intimate clothing and holds them against his cheek and thighs.
Speaks somewhat playfully and confidently over the phone with Fergus, engaging in a cat-and-mouse exchange.
Thinks through the relevance of evidence but admits difficulty in connecting it to the hiding place.
Recognizes the significance of a newspaper headline and correctly identifies a link to an assassination attempt.
Maintains composure and uses knowledge to avoid being traced during a phone call.
Provides clear and helpful directions to a vacationer asking for guidance.
Delivers cryptic and guarded information to Fergus and others, avoiding direct trust.
Gives precise directions to vacationers, showing knowledge of local geography.
Realizes he made a mistake ('he screwed up' under his breath) leading to authorities converging on the phone booth.
Speaks with confidence and directs others to check important records, showing initiative and assertiveness.
Cautiously looks around and stays alert to danger, plays it cool when sensing someone sneaking up, but punches the black hood (seal) without hesitation.
Hides silently behind equipment to eavesdrop on conversation involving Cass and Sean, indicating mistrust and suspicion.
Expresses disbelief and hurt realizing he fell for Cass's lies repeatedly.
Notices his coat is caught in dangerous gears and quickly acts to free himself, even though increasingly losing clothes; continues struggling to free his pants leg under pressure.
Despite near disrobing and physical struggle, manages to grab clothes from Cass and quickly dress himself while maintaining focus on urgent mission.
Boldly declares intention to stop an assassination despite compromised state, showing confidence and clarity under pressure.
Gets physically involved in a scuffle (slapping), indicating assertiveness but potential impulsiveness in conflicted situation.
Says 'He's finally mine. I'll be all over him like chocolate on a chin after a hot fudge sundae.'
Mocks Cass's revelation about her family ('My sister, my mother.')
Takes charge to block escape and instructs Cass to stay attentive, showing responsibility and concern to avoid blame.
Uses violent language referring to ending a relationship by 'pumping him full of lead.'
Takes charge quickly, formulates a plan to block the suspects' escape, assigns roles clearly and confidently.
Appears confused momentarily (e.g., 'Ah, good.'), showing a brief lapse in clarity.
Frantically tries to remove the plastique and timer stuck to his body while under pressure, showing determination and self-reliance.
Successfully escapes on a surfboard and returns to sabotage the submarine with plastique and a timer.
Struggles to handle the plastique, which sticks to his hands, feet, and face, complicating the bomb setup and nearly causing failure.
Reacts with pain when he slams the gun butt on his own foot, showing a genuine facial response.
Quickly retrieves a gun accidentally spun out of his hand from a teammate, avoiding disruption to the drill team.
Accidentally kicks an ear to the ground and slices off the bill of caps next to him, showing clumsiness and carelessness.
Accidentally shoots the Sergeant with his gun going off; then fiercely fights back, knocking over others and exhibits aggressive behavior while escaping.
Accidentally fires his gun when slamming it down, hitting the Sergeant and alerting everyone.
Reacts quickly by shooting at Sean and then improvises by throwing the gun and diving, knocking over adversaries and obstacles.
Shows a fierce, determined attitude with a war yell and a confident physical presence, intimidating opponents.
Despite being under fire, manages to get to his feet and take control of the situation by shoving an enemy into a van and escaping with allies.
Negotiates with a man on the street to buy a van to rescue people under fire.
Orders Mary Kelley to release everyone and offers himself in exchange.
Covers Cass and others with his body to protect them from gunfire.
Speaks to Lauren with sarcasm and wit despite danger.
Carries Cass in his arms after the rescue, receives a hero's kiss, swings her around playfully despite accidentally hitting McKintyre.
Returns a thumbs up in response to praise and shows obvious affection publicly in front of others.
Fights fiercely but also shows protective behavior for his allies and loved ones.
